version_description: Minor improvements and fresh batteries in our remotes because we're just warming up.
- Tweaks too small to notice and a popcorn refill
From today on, Watchworthy will be just the slightest bit better with minor performance enhancements.

What's new:

- We've added an option in the More screen where you can take a survey and let us know how you like Watchworthy. We're all ears.
TL;DR: work was done, updates were made, and starting today with this version, Watchworthy became ever so slightly better.

What's new:

- Starting now, we'll add things to your watchlist for you if you liked it and it's still on the air because we got your back. You can change this in Settings if you would prefer to curate your watchlist yourself. And yes, we will take it a little personally.
- Find something you like in our Rate More experience? You can now add it to your watchlist right from there. We call that multi-tv-tasking.
A teeny-tiny release containing nothing but a small, yet important bug fix.
Nothing noticeable in this release, but lots going on behind the scenes in preparation for big features on the way. Happy streaming!

What's new:

- Find what’s Worthy on Home. It has all the shows matched personally to you. We’re making way for new features so be sure to keep an eye on this space.

What's new:

- Introducing "Ask Your Friends", a new feature where you can crowdsource all the best TV suggestions from those closest to you. Once you share your personalized link, your friends can search Watchworthy and recommend their top picks for you right into your app. What are friends for, anyway?
Performance improvements and enhancements. Nothing to see here.
Small bug fixes and improvements. And now back to your regularly scheduled programming.
We did some things we needed to do for the app to continue running smoothly. Nothing to see here.
